definition: to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: He was cited for settling lawsuits correctly.
sentences.chinese: 他因断案准确而受到表彰。

sentences.english: Compurgation was used frequently in manorial courts.
sentences.chinese: 宣誓断案通常用于采邑法庭。

sentences.english: It was a major victory for the embattled software maker.
sentences.chinese: 这对陷入垄断案的微软公司来说是一个重大胜利。

sentences.english: The judge held the question in abeyance until he had the information necessary to make a decision.
sentences.chinese: 法官在得到可供断案的资料前，先搁置此案。

sentences.english: But he still has excellent judgement in solving criminal cases.
sentences.chinese: 但他对断案仍有优秀的判断力。

sentences.english: During the proceedings, the judge's trial skill was necessary to settle a lawsuit.
sentences.chinese: 在诉讼中，司法官的审判技巧也是正确断案所必需的。

definition: Song Ci (1186-1249), Southern Song lawyer, editor of Record of Washed Grievances 洗冤集錄|洗冤集录 (1247), said to be the world's first legal forensic text
to pass judgment on a legal case
Bao Zheng (999-1062), Northern Song official renowned for his honesty/modern day metaphor for an honest politician
xing-ming, a school of thought of the Warring States period associated with Shen Buhai 申不害[Shen1 Bu4 hai4]/the designation for a punishment
to bend the law in order to favor one's relatives or associates (idiom)
to solve a case/shabby old table
